attributes.comment:
Regarding the proposed rate change for the I-600 process, it seems to me that the
fees are plenty high enough as it is. If we are truly trying to encourage Americans
to adopt children overseas (and with some of the rules regarding domestic
adoption I can only assume that is what we are trying to encourage), then we
should make the process as simple and painless as possible. An I -171H that
expires in 18 months and is accompanied by fingerprints that expire in 15 months
is just ludicrous - something akin to hot dogs in packages of ten and buns in
packages of eight. The process should be modified to something that makes
sense. This would reduce the costs involved. For example, 1) make the I-171H
and the fingerprints expire at the same time and 2) make an I-171H good for at
least 24 months. This first step would reduce the number of times people would
have to be fingerprinted. The second step would reduce re-filings and more align
the validity of an I-171H with the current time lines for foreign adoptions, unless
you happen to be Madonna or Angelina Jolie - then it only takes a couple of
month anyway.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Christopher B. Richards
